## 🚀 FASTEST WAY TO START

### Option 1: One-Line Test Execution

Copy this to your GPT agent:

```
Execute: cd /Users/arog/framework/auto-coder && find generated/pages -name "*.js" -exec sed -i '' 's|../common/base-page|../../support/common/base-page|g' {} \; && ./auto-coder.sh test generated/features/jira-story-rs-end-point.feature && open file:///Users/arog/framework/auto-coder/generated/reports/custom/detailed-test-report.html
```

### Option 2: NPM Script

Copy this to your GPT agent:

```
cd /Users/arog/framework/auto-coder && npm run gpt-execute
```

### Option 3: Step-by-Step (Most Reliable)

Send your GPT agent to: **[gpt-conversation-template.md](./gpt-conversation-template.md)**

## 🔥 KEY SUCCESS FACTORS

### Why This Solution Works:

1. **Explicit Instructions** - Every step clearly defined
2. **Error Prevention** - Common issues fixed proactively
3. **Quality Templates** - Consistent output format
4. **Multiple Approaches** - NPM scripts, commands, workflows
5. **Comprehensive Coverage** - All framework aspects included

### Critical Success Requirements:

- ✅ Always fix base-page imports first
- ✅ Use exact file paths (no relative paths)
- ✅ Follow SBS_Automation patterns exactly
- ✅ Expect initial test failures (indicates success)
- ✅ Generate reports even on failures

## 🎓 TRAINING YOUR GPT AGENTS

### For New GPT Agents:

1. Start with **[gpt-quick-reference.md](./gpt-quick-reference.md)**
2. Test with simple execution commands
3. Progress to generation tasks
4. Use troubleshooting guide when needed

### For Experienced GPT Agents:

1. Use **[gpt-complete-workflows.md](./gpt-complete-workflows.md)**
2. Reference specific master guides as needed
3. Focus on quality validation steps

### For Complex Tasks:

1. Use **[gpt-test-generation-master.md](./gpt-test-generation-master.md)** for generation
2. Use **[gpt-code-fixing-master.md](./gpt-code-fixing-master.md)** for debugging
3. Use **[gpt-documentation-master.md](./gpt-documentation-master.md)** for analysis

## 🎯 VALIDATION CHECKLIST

### Your GPT Agent is Ready When:

- [ ] Can execute tests without "command not found" errors
- [ ] Generates all 5 test artifacts correctly
- [ ] Follows SBS_Automation patterns exactly
- [ ] Fixes code issues systematically
- [ ] Creates comprehensive documentation
- [ ] Provides detailed analysis and reporting
- [ ] Uses troubleshooting guides effectively

### Test Your GPT Agent:

```
Send this test prompt: "Read gpt-quick-reference.md and execute the test execution quick start command. Report results."
```

If successful, your GPT agent is ready for production use!
